intro: Mesembryanthemum minimum, commonly known as the dwarf ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers that open in response to light. The plant has a compact growth habit, typically reaching only a few centimeters in height. Its leaves are thick and often covered in a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, yellow, and white, often blooming in late spring or early summer.
